content: The reason for the Electoral College, (if you bother to read the Founders words) is the same as I posted. Small States would have never ratified the Constitution without it. For example, at that time the NEEDS of small States were often different then the needs of large states. HAS THAT CHANGED? So they made a compromise. Small States would get a "TINY" advantage. A few extra votes. So today, (As well as then) National votes were essentially decided by popular vote - BUT the politicians were forced to take the small states seriously. To my mind, this was and IS a very clever compromise. The only change I would make it to eliminate the actual "Electors," since once in a while they change their vote. Dave
